member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject
member.summary: Represents a 3D mouse object in a grid building system.
member.remarks: This class is used to represent a 3D object that is controlled by the mouse in a grid-based building system. It contains methods to update the visual representation of the mouse object, rotate the object, check for collisions, and manage the visual collision tile grid.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.HasXOffset
member.summary: Gets whether the buildable resource has an X offset.
member.remarks: The X offset is used as optimization to center the buildable resource on the grid.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.HasZOffset
member.summary: Gets whether the buildable resource has a Z offset.
member.remarks: The Z offset is used as optimization to center the buildable resource on the grid.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.SetLayerMask(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the layer mask for the mouse tiles.
member.param: The layer mask to set.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.UpdateVisual(Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource)
member.summary: Updates the visual representation of the mouse object with the specified buildable object.
member.param: The buildable object to update the visual representation with.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.ClearMouseObject
member.summary: Clears the mouse object and the grid.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.ClearGrid
member.summary: Clears the grid and removes all mouse tiles.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.Rotate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Rotates the mouse object and the grid by the specified rotation in degrees.
member.param: The rotation in degrees.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.HasMouseObject
member.summary: Checks if the mouse object exists.

member.summary: Gets the Y rotation of the mouse object in radians.

member.summary: Gets the Y rotation of the mouse object in degrees.

member.summary: Checks if the mouse object is colliding.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.AreChildrenColliding
member.summary: Checks if any of the mouse object's children are colliding.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseObject.SetTileGridVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of the tile grid.
member.param: Whether the tile grid should be visible or not.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseTile
member.summary: Represents a tile that is a part of mouse object visual.
member.remarks: Mouse tile has two states - normal and colliding. When the tile is colliding with another body, it changes its color to red. This is the place to update the visual representation of the tile when it is colliding with another body.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseTile.SetLayerMask(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the collision layer mask for the tile.
member.param: The layer mask to set.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseTile.SetSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the size of the tile.
member.param: The size of the tile.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseTile.SetVisibility(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the visibility of the tile.
member.param: Whether the tile should be visible or not.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.MouseTile.IsColliding
member.summary: Checks if the tile is currently colliding with any other bodies.
member.returns: True if the tile is colliding, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource
member.summary: Represents a buildable resource in the grid building system.
member.remarks: Every object that can be built in the grid building system needs to be a buildable resource. Creating a buildable resource allows you to define the visual representation of the object, its size, snap behavior, and other properties.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the buildable resource.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the buildable resource.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.TextureAtlas
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture atlas for the buildable resource to be used in UI.
member.remarks: Use texture atlas or texture image. Atlas has a priority over texture image.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.TextureImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture image for the buildable resource to be used in UI.
member.remarks: Use texture atlas or texture image. Atlas has a priority over texture image.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.Object3DModel
member.summary: Gets or sets the 3D model for the buildable resource.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.SnapBehaviour
member.summary: Gets or sets the snap behavior of the buildable resource.

member.name: P:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the buildable resource.
member.remarks: Size is only used for walls and floors. For walls, set X and Y and leave Z at 0. For floors, set X and Z and leave Y at 0.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResource.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: Empty constructor required for Godot serialization.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.BuildableResourceLibrary
member.summary: Represents a library of
member.remarks: This class is used to store an array of buildable objects that can be built in the grid building system. It provides an easy way of creating and managing buildable objects using multiple libraries(for testing or menus etc.).

member.summary: Gets or sets the array of buildable objects.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an empty array of buildable objects.
member.remarks: Empty constructor required for Godot serialization.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified array of buildable objects.

member.summary: Gets the buildable resource with the specified name.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem
member.summary: Provides functionality to save and load game data.
member.remarks: This is a generic class that can be used to save and load any type of data.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.useEncryption
member.summary: Determines whether encryption is enabled for saving data.
member.remarks: Encryption is enabled by default to prevent tempering with save data outside the game.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.saveExtension
member.summary: The file extension used for saving data.
member.remarks: The default extension is "json". Extension can be whatever or nothing, for example ".sav" When encryption is disabled, put "json" for readability as json is used to serialize object to a file.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.saveFolder
member.summary: The folder where save files are stored.
member.remarks: The default folder is "user://". For reference https://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/tutorials/io/data_paths.html#accessing-persistent-user-data-user

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.baseFileName
member.summary: The base file name used for saving data.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.GenerateSaveFileName
member.summary: Generates a unique save file name based on the current date and time.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.Save``1(``0,System.String)
member.summary: Saves the specified data to a file.
member.remarks: It uses JsonSerializer to serialize the data to a JSON string. Be sure to provide valid data types.
member.typeparam: The type of data to save.
member.param: The data to save.
The name of the save file. If not provided, a unique name will be generated.
member.returns: The name of the saved file.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.Load``1(System.String)
member.summary: Loads data from the specified save file.
member.remarks: It uses JsonSerializer to deserialize the data.
member.typeparam: The type of data to load.
member.param: The name of the save file to load.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.LoadMostRecentFile``1
member.summary: Loads the most recent save file.
member.typeparam: The type of data to load.
member.returns: The loaded data from the most recent save file.

member.name: M:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.SaveSystem.GetSaveFilesInfo
member.summary: Retrieves information about all the save files in the save folder.
member.returns: A list of objects representing the save files.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.Side
member.summary: Represents the sides of a 2D grid.
member.remarks: The sides are represented as follows: - MinusZ: The negative Z side - MinusX: The negative X side - Z: The positive Z side - X: The positive X side

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.Side.MinusZ
member.summary: Represents the negative Z side of a 2D grid.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.Side.MinusX
member.summary: Represents the negative X side of a 2D grid.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.Side.Z
member.summary: Represents the positive Z side of a 2D grid.

member.name: F:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.Side.X
member.summary: Represents the positive X side of a 2D grid.

member.summary: Represents an event bus that allows communication between different parts of the application.
member.remarks: Place an EventBus at the top of the scene tree for optimization.

member.summary: Finds the first MeshInstance3D child node of the specified parent node.
member.param: The parent node to search.
member.returns: The first MeshInstance3D child node found, or null if none is found.

member.summary: Registers the input actions for the grid building system.

member.name: T:Godot.GodotInGameBuildingSystem.CameraController
member.summary: Controls the movement and rotation of the camera in a 3D space.
member.remarks: This is a very simple and basic camera controller. Create a Node3D as a parent of Camera3D and attach this script to a parent node to enable camera movement and rotation.

member.summary: The movement speed of the camera.

member.summary: The rotation speed of the camera.
